lexUnit.name: smoulder.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to an intense feeling) express or be expressed in a barely suppressed state.

sentence.text: The fires of fury and hatred were smouldering in her small black eyes .
Ratagan said nothing , though fire still smouldered in his cavernous eyes .
Isabel had one quick glimpse of the fire smouldering in fitzAlan 's eyes as he lifted his head , then his mouth came down on hers in a kiss of such male dominance that she went completely limp .
And why should it , he reflected , when a sullen anger smouldered in him still ?
Like a fire that has been damped down but not extinguished , anger smouldered in Lou 's eyes .
She felt that all compassion must have passed from Emilia with the emptying of her womb except for this last residue that smouldered in the promise she exacted now .
He was also formidable , demanding , difficult -- and smouldering with anger , but she still found it impossible to tear her gaze away .
Anna smouldered with indignation on poor Sophie 's behalf .
His blue doublet was gold laced ; his breast plate gleamed ; his face , under its heavy helmet was smouldering with a familiar rage , and his dark eyes flared .
On the outside he was coolly polite , but underneath he was smouldering with rage .
It would have been hard to sit there smouldering with scorn while all around children were bouncing about delivering their verdict of unrestrained approval .
The eyes smouldered for a moment at the impertinence , then he seemed to see the funny side and chuckled hoarsely .
It seemed to Tallis that she had smouldered for a long time before finally the fire had taken hold .

Oh , André was always a hit with the girls , and he did have a certain effeminate appeal and a wonderful way with words , but he lacked Piers 's vitality , the vibrant sexuality that seemed to smoulder away inside him .
The honey-sweet warmth that had smouldered deep inside her exploded , filling her with a shimmering liquid heat .
When he turned around to face her his dark eyes were smouldering .
A measure of freedom to the son , and the last indignity to the father 's bones -- what manner of dealing is that ? " said Llewelyn , smouldering .
